thread.title: Call the Midwife's Reggie and Sister Mary Cynthia storyline might be the saddest episode ever, say fans
thread.title_full: Call the Midwife's Reggie and Sister Mary Cynthia storyline might be the saddest episode ever, say fans

author: Huw Fullerton
title: Call the Midwife's Reggie and Sister Mary Cynthia storyline might be the saddest episode ever, say fans
text:
Viewers think this week’s Call the Midwife could be the saddest episode yet The return of an old face and a young man's struggle had fans bawling their eyes out ARTICLE CONTINUES BELOW 
By Huw Fullerton Sunday 19 February 2017 at 9:07PM 
This week’s episode of Call the Midwife has been called the saddest yet by viewers at home, after a story that saw a young boy left motherless and an old friend trapped in a mental hospital. You know, typically cheery Sunday-evening stuff. 
First, fans found their eyes getting damp at the tragic tale of Reggie, a young man with Down’s Syndrome played by Daniel Laurie whose mother died at Mass and left him adrift in the world, presumably bound for an unhappy future in a mental hospital. 
Reaction was, shall we say, passionate. — Sarah Jones (@ohyeahitssarah_) February 19, 2017 Please, please don't send him to a hospital please let him stay with Fred!!! #callthemidwife
